snippet: President Obama is moving to declassify records that could show what the United States knew about Argentina’s brutal crackdowns of the 1970s and ’80s.
abstract: National Security Adviser Susan E Rice announces that during his trip to Argentina Pres Obama will begin declassification of government records on that nation's 'dirty war' of 1970s and 80s; says move is to honor victims of era on 40th anniversary of start of the war.
lead_paragraph: President Obama is moving to declassify records that could show what the United States knew about Argentina’s brutal crackdowns of the 1970s and ’80s.

headline.main: Obama to Unseal Files on Argentina’s ‘Dirty War’
headline.print_headline: Obama to Unseal Files on Argentina’s ‘Dirty War’

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
